title: Protest Typography
content:
Sure, it's hand-lettered, but I'm much more used to seeing poorly-kerned/spaced letting on my political protest banners. What am I talking about? It's [this](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014090850/http:/www.nobodydied.com/) gem.   
   
Almost makes me wonder if a type designer is involved.
author: fontosaurus

comments.content:
Dan, isn't that Copperplate?   
   
along the same lines,   
Milton Glaser did this for The Nation....   
   
   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014090850im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/30/16322.jpg)   
   
   
if you missed it, Glaser v. Barnbrook   
   
  [http://www.idanda.net](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014090850/http:/www.idanda.net/)
I wasn't referring to the site design itself...I was referring to the lettering on the placards by the freeway.

sorry to be dense, but which one?   
   
i see courier and times...   
   
can you post the .gif or .jpg...   
   
thanks   
   
bj
